projects.name: Text Detection in Distorted Social Media Images Using Genetic Programming
highlights: Developed a model to detect text in natural images distorted by continuous sharing on social media
Used MSER to fetch connected components and developed a 3x3 filter using genetic programming
Classified the components as text and non-text and used the text components with iterative dilation to create bounding boxes around the text

projects.name: Android Malware Classification
highlights: Implemented sampling techniques to address the issue of working with large datasets
Implemented Principal Component Analysis (PCA) for exploratory data analysis and to reduce the dimension since the dataset had large number of columns (9503)
Trained Artificial Neural Networks (ANN) to achieve an accuracy of 67%

projects.name: Hope Speech Detection on Social Media Platforms
highlights: Trained a Natural Language Processing (NLP) based system to classify text comments as Hope, Non-Hope speech
Implemented techniques such as Bag of Words, TF-IDF, Word2Vec for text vectorization
Used data balancing techniques (SMOTE, ADASYN, etc)
Intriduced a third label (Neutral Speech) for better classification
Analyzes and experimented on both the datsasets (old and new) with conventional ML models, LSTMs, and adopted BERT Architecture
Published as a book chapter in Cyber Crime in Social Media (CCSM), August 2022.

projects.name: Random Decision Forest Approach for Mitigating SQL Injection Attacks
projects.summary: Trained a classifier to identify and mitigate SQL injection attacks. Collected data(malicious sql queries) and identified features to streamline the data for better insights. Scored a list of keywords according to their risk factors getting an accuracy of about 95%. Presented our paper at IEEE CONECCT, Bangalore, India 2021
highlights: Trained a classifier to identify and mitigate SQL injection attacks
Collected data (malicious queries) and identified features to streamline the data for better insights
Scored a list of keywords according to their risk factors getting an accuracy of about 95%
